Mike Pence  ruled out a White House bid in a letter sent to supporters that also fueled speculation he is instead planning a run for governor.  We have been especially humbled by the confidence and support of those who believe we should pursue the presidency, but after much deliberation and prayer, we believe our calling is closer to home,   Mike Pence  wrote in the letter. "In the choice between seeking national office and serving Indiana in some capacity, we choose Indiana. We will not seek the Republican nomination for  Barack Obama  in 2012.""

Mike Pence  said this was his first town hall since the Tucson, Ariz., shootings and he always consults with local law enforcement on security at such events.  To me the focus is and should remain on public safety. We volunteer for these jobs, but just because someone comes to a town hall meeting, they should never have to be concerned that there's not a reasonable amount of security,  he said. He said town hall meetings are "very routine""  for him and said he was grateful that everyone came out Monday in the wake of the Tucson shootings.___
